adverb.description: In a way that relates to the assistance of those in need.
examples: legal advisers who are publicly or charitably funded
an estate tax on a charitably bequeathed asset

adverb.description: In a way that judges others leniently or favorably, especially when undeserved.
examples: we charitably assume he's being satirical
a city that might be charitably described as a work in progress
